item.description:
Join us between 2 and 4 PM for an opportunity to see and discuss an on-going quest by one Newburyport family toward food independence.

Currently in it's 3rd year the goal for this project, now a 550-sq.ft. raised-bed garden, is to produce enough food to feed this family of 4 year-round. In addition to demonstrating common gardening techniques — such as mulching, drip irrigation, and composting — this site is designed for 4-season gardening, and features a perennial vegetable bed. The project also incorporates the food preservation practices of fermentation, dehydration and root cellaring. The underlying philosophy of the garden design is to be low-impact and sustainable, using as few inputs from outside the household as possible.

This event is part of the Transition Newburyport local food series and will serve as a kick-off for the beginning of a monthly group meeting in Newburyport. The group will be open to anyone interested in learning and sharing information about food gardening. The first meeting will be scheduled in October. Whether you are a novice or an experienced food gardener, or just want to learn how to get started, this is for you.
item.name: Invitation to an Edible Garden: One Family's Journey Toward Food Independence
